description.S1: Now that the station has been secured as a holding of SubLight Salvage,
description.S2: Lilya Hagen will be interested in an update.
description.S3: She can be found in SubLight Headquarters on the Groundbreaker.

blurb.B1: Then head back to Lilya on Groundbreaker.
blurb.B2: You can inform her of the scientists and (if you disabled the mechs) tell her they are now up for grabs (15000xp).
blurb.B3: Completing the quest will net you 35000 XP and SubLight Salvage & Shipping Reputation as well as 2188 Bit Cartridges.
blurb.B4: Lilya will ask you if you encountered any resistance at the station,
blurb.B5: and you can either tell her the truth or Lie (1) to her.
blurb.B6: Either way Lilya will reveal that none of this was about salvage,
blurb.B8: She thinks there is an Alien invasion happening,
blurb.B9: and she wants you to put a stop to it.
blurb.B10: You can ask what she means by Aliens,
blurb.B11: and she will say that the gas is mixing the human nuclein with Halcyon biology,
blurb.B12: making us something other than human.
blurb.B13: If you ask how she knows you're not an alien,
blurb.B14: she will say it was a calculated risk,
blurb.B15: and she will say it's "Probably nothing to worry about as long as you don't start growing tentacles or slowing down time".

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Finally, a base of our own! Soon we'll have eyes on every corner of the system. Well done, Captain.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You'll also find some automech salvage awaiting new owners.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The base had scientists in suspension tanks. Some might still be alive.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is that all? I didn't do this for charity.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Have you got any more work for me?

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'll have those dismantled. You can never be too careful when moving into someone else's territory.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Aside from the automated security, did you meet any resistance at the station?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A UDL gunship buzzed the station, but I convinced them to back off.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It was an easy job. No surprises.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ha, I knew it! They've been shadowing us since Monarch. Maybe even longer.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I've been less than honest with you. Your assignments weren't strictly about the salvage business. You might have figured that out already.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Rare gas and a lab that tested it on people? Couldn't have been a coincidence.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm listening.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I hope that means I'm due for a raise.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: You have an eye for patterns. Good. We need more contractors like you.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: After the Monarch job, I started connecting the dots. I didn't like the picture. Then what we found at Station Ten Eighty-Four confirmed my fears.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: You and I have stumbled onto something big. Something none of us were meant to know.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Bad news, I take it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The truth about the human tailbone?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You had my interest. Now you have my attention.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Maybe the worst.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ask yourself why a skeleton crew was studying that Alta-Vitae gas in secret. Ask yourself why stockpiles were hidden on a planet full of monsters.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm guessing you have an idea.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe they were just hiding expensive research from pirates like SubLight.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Before we go any further, I want you to keep an open mind. Can you do that for me, Captain?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can do that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I guess that depends on what we're talking about.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This had better be good.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Aliens. I'm talking about aliens. They're the ones responsible for the deaths at Ten Eighty-Four, and who knows what else. We have to put a stop to it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Aliens?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Aliens.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Really?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Say nothing.>

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hear me out.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm saying it's aliens. I'm not asking you to like it. I'm not even asking you to believe it. But I need to act on this threat to the colony, and I can't do it alone.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I assume you have questions.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A few.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This is completely insane.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Skip to the part where I get paid. I don't care what hallucinogens you're on.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: If we're gonna see this through, I'll need your trust and commitment. Now's the time for setting doubts aside.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: When you say "aliens," what are we talking about here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How do you know I'm not an alien spy on a mission to silence you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Enough. Tell me what needs to be done.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I really don't know what to make of this, Lilya.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: A conspiracy. One carried out with the help of human collaborators, assuming they haven't all been replaced.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: This is an invasion of our very cells. That damned gas is mixing our nuclein with Halcyon biology to twist us. Change us. Make us more like those monsters on Monarch.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I haven't seen any evidence of aliens.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I joined SubLight so I could do crimes. Not save humanity.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The little green bastards must pay.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: No kidding. That's how they want it.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: When I lined up the evidence in my spreadsheet, there was only one possible conclusion looking back at me. This is my data talking, not my anxiety or lack of sleep.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: We'll get back to "business as usual" when this is behind us. Promise.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Terrific. That go-getter initiative will carry you far in SubLight.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sharing my findings took a calculated risk. If you were a spy, I doubt you'd even realize it. Only your cells would know.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well that's comforting.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Cross your eyes.> We're coming to get you, Lilya.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Probably nothing to worry about as long as you don't start growing tentacles or slowing down time.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm not laughing, Captain. They got Tobias already. I won't let them get me too.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you don't believe me, go pay a visit to the puppet master who's working against her own kind.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Remember what I said about keeping an open mind?

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Huh. You took that better than I thought.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: You call that an open mind? All right. Here goes.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: No. They were hiding something the colony isn't ready to know.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm thinking more along the lines of the Sapient Species Paradox.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Glad to know it, Captain.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: How does an executive-level promotion sound? You can give yourself a raise.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Why would they leave an asset like that unprotected? Unless... could the station be a trap? Unlikely. But possibly. One more thing to consider.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: I heard about that. While my lawyers scratch their heads wondering how we deal with human salvage, I'm leaving the researchers in hibernation.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: Technically you did. Among other things, SubLight is a charity. Legally-speaking. Or so my lawyers tell me. It's a tax thing. Here, just take the bits.

dialog.speaker: LilyaHagen (Female)
dialog.utterance: First I need to get something off my chest.
